name: Tivoli Ecoresort Praia do Forte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, really nice staff, wonderful spa. When staying in this hotel, even if you arent at a room that gives the spa for free, you should go and buy any massage/treatment in the spa and use it for a whole day. Its marvelous!!!! Private swimming pools at the spa, quiet and relaxing ambient... Everything u need for a relaxing and romantic trip. Would go back there definitely!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: Stayed over New Year. Beatiful location on film set palm beach. Rooms very average, no better than 4 star and bathroom a bit shabby - rusty basin fitments- a balcony with two wicker chairs, no lounger and no table. Top price rooms (ours was middling) appeared to have bigger TVs and loungers but not much else. Staff friendly enough but little or no English other than at reception. Not inherently a problem but a bit tedious when you have to spend two minutes miming for a Coke Zero. Plenty of pool space but an early morning race for the loungers for dedicated sun worshippers.
reviews.title: Poor value for money

reviews.text: Food (buffet) good. Spa enormous and beatifully furnished but badly maintained (plunge pool and wet sauna had not been working for some time). Cost is extra ($30/day/person). Local town is a small lively beach resort.
reviews.title: club-med with no ambiance

reviews.text: It advertises itself as an eco resort, but little extra activity laid on by the hotel. Excursions (we did rainforest and trip to Salavador) were good but at a price.
reviews.title: A very pleasant experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall left with the impression that this is very expensive for a relatively average beach resort hotel.
reviews.title: Quiet, peaceful and romantic place...

reviews.text: I am Brazilian but I have been living in France for more than 10 years. My wife and I have been to the Eco Resort a couple of times, the first being in 2002.
reviews.title: Paradise...but with some kinks

reviews.text: This is, in my opinion, the best resort in Bahia and one of the top 3 in Brazil. It still provides outstanding cuisine, spacious and comfortable rooms, friendly and competent personnel, unbeatable and safe location and all facilities and service one can ask of a 5 stars hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.text: All of that, of course, comes with a price, but it is worth the cost. However, those that have known it for long feel that the new Management has changed it from a cozy and exclusive establishment integrated into the community to a 5 star cash machine. They increased capacity and prices, and ended some community programs. We actually feel more pressured to spend money in the beach restaurant, and the staff lost some of its natural, layback attitude. Everyone I have spoken with agrees that prices skyrocketed and it lost a bit of soul after it was sold to an investment group.
reviews.title: Trully Exceptional

reviews.text: The kinks I would like to mention are related to the guests rather to the hotel itself; these are things the hotel will have a hard time fixing (if they ever try).
reviews.title: Not really a five-star hotel

reviews.text: - First, some guests created an underground service for reserving beach-front chairs that makes the whole system corrupt and very unfair. If you want a beach front chair, you need to either wake up at 5:30 am (like we used to do), or pay the “caixinha” to the employees responsible for cleaning the chairs. The hotel management is aware of the issue but they have yet to find an effective solution. It is very unfortunate that guests are contributing to one of the worst problems in Brazil by corrupting employees instead of making the effort to earn a place in the sun…
reviews.title: Bahia Nightmare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reasonably good location on unspoilt quiet beach. Hotel is large and has good facilities (although English not spoken in the kids club). Rooms nothing special but do have a hammock and small outside area. Pools nice but NOT heated. Not really a true luxury hotel as no small touches; no cooling treats while you are lying at the pool/beach for example.
reviews.title: Monkeys are the best bit!

reviews.text: Snacks/drinks/Spa VERY expensive.
reviews.title: don't bother

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet a bit dull, dinner better.
reviews.title: The EcoResort is finally back to its outstanding Quality standard"

reviews.text: As says it all, "Excellent three star young family hotel", but seriously wouldn't have made the effort of traveling had I known. Service is horrible, pool are really quite disgusting, and the food.... Only upset as this is actually sold as a five star resort, they have a long way to go before that could be true!
reviews.title: Beware ! Terrible value !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The EcoResort was the best beach hotel I knew in the world. Thais was before it was taken over by the Tivoli Group (I have been a frequent guest there for the last 12 years). Understandably the years post merger saw a bit of hesitation and needed adaptation time between the new Portuguese owners and the very strong culture that had maintained the Resort to the top of the list. It seems now that things are back on track and our recent stay was the best ever. The extraordinary (best in Brazil) service level, the kindness of the people, the hard to imitate blend of informality of the Bahia people and a very high professional standard are back.
reviews.title: Truly Magical

reviews.text: After my business trip to Sao Paulo, I decided to spend a long weekend in Praia do Forte in the beautiful state of Bahia. Overall a fantastic experience: relaxing, authentic Brazilian and great value for money.
reviews.title: Relax in the nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was impressed by the welcome of hotel staff at the airport and I was taken straight to the hotel. I booked a very comfortable deluxe suite with sea view. I loved the gardens and nature around the estate and the size of the hotel, that guarantees privacy.
reviews.title: Good for families but not for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had dinner in 2 different restaurants, great quality of food and good choice at the buffet. Breakfast was also an amazing experience, after 45 minutes of jogging along the beach.
reviews.title: Wonderful real estate, terrible service and maintenance!!!

reviews.text: Enjoyed the infinity pool and even more the amazing SPA and relaxation area. Price for treatment was very reasonable, 45 Pounds for a full body massage.
reviews.title: Great secluded Beach resort, for a relaxing break

reviews.text: Went out to the nearby fishing village one night and found a fun and relaxed atmosphere, you can have a beer and listen to some live local music.
reviews.title: Just had my wedding at the resort. Above average, very expensive for what you get

aka: Tivoli Ecoresort Praia Do Forte Hotel Mata De Sao Joao
description: In Brazil, to the north of Salvador, Bahia, there is an idyllic place for Ecotourism lovers, which is both beautiful and luxurious. The Tivoli Ecoresort Praia do Forte (former Praia do Forte EcoResort & Thalasso Spa) is a 5 star hotel where simple architecture is in harmony with the stunning scenery and the biodiversity of the surrounding area.Here you will find a tropical destination perfect for family holidays, business meetings, events, birthdays or a dream honeymoon. Enjoy the extensive range of well-being treatments at the Thalasso SPA and relax among the colourful gardens and natural pools in Vila Praia do Forte. The exclusive cuisine at the resort restaurants promises a culinary journey through exotic flavours blended with touches of the sea and coconuts.
